gr.forth.ics.jbenchy.diagram
Interface Diagram

All Known Implementing Classes:
DiagramFactory.DiagramImpl
public interface Diagram

A diagram is a tabular data set, comprising a number of named dimensions (variables), and a value for each cell.

A diagram maintains the (ordered) domain of each variable. For example, if there are two variables, "COLOR" and "SIZE", and color has domain: [RED, GREEN, BLUE] and size has domain: [SMALL, MEDIUM, BIG], then the following indices correspond to the points appearing below:

INDEX POINT
(0, 0) (RED, SMALL)
(0, 1) (RED, MEDIUM)
(0, 2) (RED, BIG)
(1, 0) (GREEN, SMALL)
(1, 1) (GREEN, MEDIUM)
(1, 2) (GREEN, BIG)
(2, 0) (BLUE, SMALL)
(2, 1) (BLUE, MEDIUM)
(2, 2) (BLUE, BIG)

Author:
andreou

Method Summary
 java.util.List<java.lang.Object> getDomain(int variableIndex)
          Returns the union of all possible values that a variable (expressed by its index, counting from 0) takes.
 int getDomainSize(int variableIndex)
          Returns the domain size for a variable (denoted by its index).
 java.lang.String getLabelOf(int variableIndex)
          Returns the label of a variable (expressed by its index, counting from 0).
 java.lang.String getRangeLabel()
          Returns the label describing the contents of this diagram cells.
 Record getRecordAt(int... variableIndices)
          Returns the record which resides in the specified diagram cell, denoted by an offset for each variable.
 java.lang.String getTitle()
          Returns the title of this diagram.
 int getVariableCount()
          Returns the number of variables (or dimensions) in this diagram.
 java.util.List<java.lang.String> getVariables()
          Returns the ordered list of variables, corresponding to the dimensions of this diagram.

getDomain

java.util.List<java.lang.Object> getDomain(int variableIndex)
Returns the union of all possible values that a variable (expressed by its index, counting from 0) takes.

getRecordAt

Record getRecordAt(int... variableIndices)
Returns the record which resides in the specified diagram cell, denoted by an offset for each variable.

Parameters:
variableIndices - the indices that describe the position of the record. Each variable index means the offset of the value in the domain of that variable's domain.
Returns:
the record residing in the described cell

getVariables

java.util.List<java.lang.String> getVariables()
Returns the ordered list of variables, corresponding to the dimensions of this diagram.

getVariableCount

int getVariableCount()
Returns the number of variables (or dimensions) in this diagram.

getDomainSize

int getDomainSize(int variableIndex)
Returns the domain size for a variable (denoted by its index). This is the upper bound (exclusively) of valid index values that can be used for the Nth variable index in getRecordAt(int[]) method.

This is equivalent to getDomain(variableIndex).size().

Parameters:
variableIndex - the variable of which to return the domain size
Returns:
the size of the variable domain
